title: Brace - Shock Tower (Remove and Replace)
full_text:
2025-06-12 Brace - Shock Tower (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010055312 FRT 0.60 NOTE: Unless
                        otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and
                        FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including
                        the linked procedures. Do
                            not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate
                            Times to learn more about FRTs and how
                        they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com . NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and
                        healthy working practices. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications : Brace - Shock Tower (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolt that attaches the ground strap to the A/C compressor 7 Nm (5.2 lbs-ft) Torx T25 socket Reuse Bolts (x2) that attach the A/C compressor assembly to the brace 31 Nm (22.9 lbs-ft) 15 mm socket Reuse Bolts (x2) that attach the supermanifold to the shock tower brace 31 Nm (22.9 lbs-ft) 15 mm socket Reuse The LH and RH bolts (x4) that attach the shock tower brace to the body 55 Nm (40.6 lbs-ft) 15 mm socket Reuse The LH and RH outer bolts that attach the shock tower brace to the body 62 Nm (45.7 lbs-ft) 15 mm socket Reuse Remove Expand All | Collapse All Remove the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace) . Remove the cabin intake duct. See Duct - Air Intake (Remove and Replace) . Remove LV power. See LV Battery (Remove and Install) . Use a clip pry tool to release the
            clips (x4) that attach the coolant hose to the A/C compressor bracket. Release the connector locking tab, and
            then disconnect the HVIL connector near the LH front strut tower. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note DO NOT push down on the red locking tab. Pull
              the tab away from the connector until the connector is unlocked, and then continue
              pulling to release the connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Pick Miniature Soft Grip, 90
                        degree tip, 6 in Release the connector locking tab,
            then disconnect the A/C logic electrical connector from the A/C compressor. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note DO NOT push down on the red locking tab. Pull
              the tab away from the connector until the connector is unlocked, and then continue
              pulling to release the connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Pick Miniature Soft Grip, 90
                        degree tip, 6 in Use a clip pry tool to release the
            retaining clip that attaches the A/C compressor logic harness to the A/C compressor HV
            harness bracket. Remove the bolt that attaches the
            ground strap to the A/C compressor, and then set the ground strap aside. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Torx T25 socket Use a clip pry tool to release the
            clip that attaches the coolant hose to the A/C compressor bracket. Remove the retaining clips (x5) that
            attach the A/C compressor HV harness to the shock tower brace. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Pull upward on the clip to assist with removal. Do not pull
              upward on the HV cable. Place a fender cover (1115212-00-A) on
            the front underhood storage unit reinforcement beam to prevent damage to other
            components. With an assistant, remove the bolts
            (x2) that attach the A/C compressor assembly to the strut tower brace, and then
            carefully maneuver the assembly towards the front of the vehicle, under the strut tower
            support brace. Rest the A/C compressor assembly on the front underhood storage unit
            reinforcement beam. Warning Icon A warning icon, calling your attention to a possibly risky situation CAUTION Do not rest the A/C
              compressor on the HV connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket Secure the supermanifold assembly with  bungee cords. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Install bungee cord to RH hood strut bracket. Route bungee cord around accumulator
              housing and secure to the RH body side. Do not secure bungee cord around coolant pumps
              or plastic housing on supermanifold. Use a mirror as needed to visual check bungee
              cord around accumulator housing. Remove the bolts (x2) that attach the supermanifold to the shock tower brace. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket Remove the LH and RH bolts (x4) that attach the shock tower brace to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket Remove the LH and RH outer bolts (x2) that attach the shock tower brace to the body,
            and then remove the shock tower brace from the vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket Install Expand All | Collapse All Position the shock tower brace to the vehicle, and then loosely install the LH and RH
            bolts (x6) that attach the shock tower brace to the body. Torque the LH and RH outer bolts (x2)
            that attach the shock tower brace to the body. 62 Nm (45.7 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket Torque the LH and RH bolts (x4) that
            attach the shock tower brace to the body. 55 Nm (40.6 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket With an assistant supporting the A/C compressor assembly under the strut tower brace,
            install the bolts (x2) that attach the supermanifold to the shock tower brace. 31 Nm (22.9 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket Remove the bungee cords from the supermanifold assembly. With an assistant supporting the A/C
            compressor assembly under the strut tower brace, hand-start the bolts (x2) that attach
            the A/C compressor assembly to the brace, and then torque the bolts. 31 Nm (22.9 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 15 mm socket Remove the fender cover from the front
            underhood storage unit support beam. Install the retaining clips (x5) that
            attach the A/C compressor HV harness to the shock tower support brace. Install the clip that attaches the
            coolant hose to the A/C compressor bracket. Position the ground strap on the A/C
            compressor, and then install the bolt that attaches the ground strap to the A/C
              compressor. 7 Nm (5.2 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Torx T25 socket Install the retaining clip that
            attaches the A/C compressor logic harness to the A/C compressor HV harness
            bracket. Connect the A/C compressor logic
            electrical connector to the A/C compressor, and then engage the locking tab. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Push the red locking tab into the connector to
              engage the locking mechanism. DO NOT push down or pull up on the red locking
              tab. Connect the HVIL connector near the LH
            front strut tower, and then engage the locking tab. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Push the red locking
              tab into the connector to engage the locking mechanism. DO NOT push down or pull up on
              the red locking tab. Install the clips (x4) that attach the
            coolant hose to the A/C compressor bracket. Install LV power. See LV Battery (Remove and Install) . Remove the cabin intake duct. See Duct - Air Intake (Remove and Replace) . Install the underhood storage unit.
            See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace) .

title: Cowl Screen Bracket (Remove and Replace)
full_text:
2025-03-12 Cowl Screen Bracket (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010040102 FRT 0.20 NOTE: Unless
                        otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and
                        FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including
                        the linked procedures. Do
                            not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate
                            Times to learn more about FRTs and how
                        they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com . NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and
                        healthy working practices. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications : Cowl Screen Bracket (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Stud bolt that attaches the positive jumper post to the cowl screen
              bracket 8 Nm (5.9 lbs-ft) External Torx E5 Reuse Bolt that attaches the cowl screen bracket to the body 7 Nm (5.2 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Reuse Remove Expand All | Collapse All Remove the cowl screen panel. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace) . Remove the positive jumper post cap. Remove the stud bolt that attaches the positive jumper post to the cowl
                        screen bracket. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: External Torx E5 Remove the bolt that attaches the cowl screen bracket to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Release the tabs (x2) that attach the cowl screen bracket to the vehicle,
                        and then remove it from the vehicle. Install Expand All | Collapse All Install the tabs (x2) that attach the cowl screen bracket to the
                        vehicle. Install the bolt that attaches the cowl screen bracket to the body. 7 Nm (5.2 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Install the stud bolt that attaches the positive jumper post to the cowl
                        screen bracket. 8 Nm (5.9 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: External Torx E5 Install the positive jumper post cap. Install the cowl screen panel. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace) .

title: Fem Bracket - LH (Remove and Replace)
full_text:
2025-03-12 Fem Bracket - LH (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010050102 FRT 0.80 NOTE: Unless
                        otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and
                        FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including
                        the linked procedures. Do
                            not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate
                            Times to learn more about FRTs and how
                        they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com . NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and
                        healthy working practices. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications : Fem Bracket - LH (Remove and Replace) / Fem Bracket - RH (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolts that attach the FEM bracket assembly to the body 30 Nm (22.1 lbs-ft) 13 mm deep socket Reuse Bolts that attach the FEM bracket to the front fender 6.5 Nm (4.8 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Reuse Bolts that attach the FEM bracket assembly to the FEM 16 Nm (11.8 lbs-ft) 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension Reuse Remove Expand All | Collapse All Remove the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Remove the front lightbar assembly.
            See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install) . Remove the LH front wheel. See Wheel Assembly (Remove and Install) . Remove the front fascia assembly from
            the vehicle. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace) . Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Do not separate the valance, the
              grille and the harness from the front fascia. Disconnect the cooling fan
            connector. Disconnect the LH FEM harness
            connector. Disconnect the LH front pedestrian
            protection pressure tube sensor. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Do not push down on the red tab.
              Pull it to disengage the lock, and then pull it again to release the connector. Release the harness clip from the LH
            crush can. Release the harness clip from the
            FEM. Release 4 of the LH front wheel liner
            clips. Partially remove the LH front wheel
            liner. Release the LH front wheel speed
            sensor harness clips (x2) from the body. Disconnect the LH Front wheel speed
            sensor connector. Remove the FEM bracket LH crash
            accelerometer sensor. See Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the LH headlamp
            connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Pull the tab to disengage the lock
              mechanism, and then pull it again to release the connector. Do not press down on the
              tab. Release the clip that attaches the
            front harness to the LH FEM bracket assembly. Remove the harness from the LH FEM
            bracket assembly. Remove the bolts (x3) that attach the
            LH FEM bracket assembly to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Remove the bolt that attaches the FEM
            bracket to the LH front fender. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the bolt that attaches the LH
            FEM bracket assembly to the FEM, and then remove the LH FEM bracket assembly from the
            vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension Install Expand All | Collapse All Hand-tighten the bolt that attaches
            the LH FEM bracket assembly to the FEM. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Torque at later steps. Hand-tighten the bolt that attaches
            the FEM bracket to the LH front fender. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Torque at later steps. Hand-tighten the bolts (x3) that
            attach the LH FEM bracket assembly to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Torque at later steps. Torque the bolts (x3) that attach the
            LH FEM bracket assembly to the body. 30 Nm (22.1 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Torque the bolt that attaches the FEM
            bracket to the LH front fender. 6.5 Nm (4.8 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Torque the bolt that attaches the LH
            FEM bracket assembly to the FEM. 16 Nm (11.8 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension Route the front harness through the LH
            FEM bracket assembly. Secure the clip that attaches the
            front harness to the LH FEM bracket assembly. Install the FEM bracket LH crash
            accelerometer sensor. See Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace) . Clip the front harness to the LH crush
            can. Clip the front harness to the
            FEM. Connect the LH headlamp
            connector. Connect the LH front pedestrian
            protection pressure tube sensor. Install the clips (x2) that attach the
            LH front wheel speed sensor harness to the body. Connect the LH front wheel speed
            sensor connector. Install the LH front wheel
            liner. Install the 4 LH front wheel liner
            clips. Connect the LH FEM harness
            connector. Connect the cooling fan
            connector. Install the front fascia assembly to
            the vehicle. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace) . Install the LH front wheel. See Wheel Assembly (Remove and Install) . Install the front lightbar assembly.
            See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install) . Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Install the underhood storage unit.
            See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace) .

title: Fem Bracket - RH (Remove and Replace)
full_text:
2025-03-12 Fem Bracket - RH (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010050202 FRT 0.80 NOTE: Unless
                        otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and
                        FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including
                        the linked procedures. Do
                            not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate
                            Times to learn more about FRTs and how
                        they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com . NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and
                        healthy working practices. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications : Fem Bracket - LH (Remove and Replace) / Fem Bracket - RH (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolts that attach the FEM bracket assembly to the body 30 Nm (22.1 lbs-ft) 13 mm deep socket Reuse Bolts that attach the FEM bracket to the front fender 6.5 Nm (4.8 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Reuse Bolts that attach the FEM bracket assembly to the FEM 16 Nm (11.8 lbs-ft) 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension Reuse Remove Expand All | Collapse All Remove the underhood storage unit. See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Remove the front lightbar assembly.
            See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install) . Remove the RH front wheel. See Wheel Assembly (Remove and Install) . Remove the front fascia assembly from
            the vehicle. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace) . Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Do not separate the valance, the
              grille and the harness from the front fascia. Disconnect the RH FEM harness
            connector. Disconnect the RH front pedestrian
            protection pressure tube sensor. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Do not push down on the red tab.
              Pull it to disengage the lock, and then pull it again to release the connector. Release the harness clips (x2) from
            the RH headlamp. Release the harness clip from the RH
            crush can. Release 4 of the RH front wheel liner
            clips. Partially remove the RH front wheel
            liner. Release the RH front wheel speed
            sensor harness clips (x2) from the body. Disconnect the RH front wheel speed
            sensor connector. Remove the FEM bracket RH crash
            accelerometer sensor. See Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the RH headlamp
            connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Pull the tab to disengage the lock
              mechanism, and then pull it again to release the connector. Do not press down on the
              tab. Release the harness clip from the
            FEM. Release the front harness clip from
            the RH FEM bracket assembly. Remove the harness from the RH FEM
            bracket assembly. Remove the bolts (x3) that attach the
            RH FEM bracket assembly to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Remove the bolt that attaches the FEM
            bracket to the RH front fender. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the bolt that attaches the RH
            FEM bracket assembly to the FEM, and then remove the RH FEM bracket assembly from the
            vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension Install Expand All | Collapse All Hand-tighten the bolt that attaches
            the RH FEM bracket assembly to the FEM. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Torque at later steps. Hand-tighten the bolt that attaches
            the FEM bracket to the RH front fender. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Torque at later steps. Hand-tighten the bolts (x3) that
            attach the RH FEM bracket assembly to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Torque at later steps. Torque the bolts (x3) that attach the
            RH FEM bracket assembly to the body. 30 Nm (22.1 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Torque the bolt that attaches the FEM
            bracket to the RH front fender. 6.5 Nm (4.8 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Torque the bolt that attaches the RH
            FEM bracket assembly to the FEM. 16 Nm (11.8 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket 10 in extension Route the front harness through the RH
            FEM bracket assembly. Secure the front harness clip to the
            RH FEM bracket assembly. Connect the RH headlamp
            connector. Install the FEM bracket RH crash
            accelerometer sensor. See Single Axis - 480G - Crash Accel Sensor (Remove and Replace) . Clip the front harness to the
            FEM. Clip the front harness to the RH crush
            can. Connect the RH front pedestrian
            protection pressure tube sensor. Install the clips (x2) that attach the
            RH front wheel speed sensor harness to the body. Connect the RH Front wheel speed
            sensor connector. Install the RH front wheel
            liner. Install the 4 RH front wheel liner
            clips. Clip the harness to the RH
            headlamp. Connect the RH FEM harness
            connector. Install the front fascia assembly to
            the vehicle. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace) . Install the RH front wheel. See Wheel Assembly (Remove and Install) . Install the front lightbar assembly.
            See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install) . Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Install the underhood storage unit.
            See Underhood Storage Unit (Remove and Replace) .

title: Fender - LH (Remove and Replace)
full_text:
2025-07-23 Fender - LH (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010030102 FRT 0.96 NOTE: Unless
                        otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and
                        FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including
                        the linked procedures. Do
                            not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate
                            Times to learn more about FRTs and how
                        they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com . NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and
                        healthy working practices. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications : Fender - LH (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolts (x5) and nuts (x2) that attach the LH front fender bracket to
              the body 9.8 Nm (7.2 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Reuse Remove Expand All | Collapse All Open the LH front door and lower the
            LH front window. Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Remove the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install) . Remove the front fascia assembly. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace) . Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note No need to separate the valance, the front fascia harness and the grille from the
              front fascia assembly. Remove the LH headlamp. See Headlamp Assembly - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH fascia side bracket from
            fender. See Bracket - Fascia Side to Fender - LH (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the cowl screen from the LH
            carrier bracket. Remove the bolts (x5) that attach the
            LH front fender bracket to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the nuts (x2) that attach the LH lower front fender bracket to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Disconnect the side repeater
            connectors (x2). Remove the LH front fender assembly
            from the vehicle. Release the clip and tabs (x2) to
            remove the LH side repeater. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Press to release the clip. Remove the frunk fender clips (x3)
            from the LH front fender. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Replace any damaged clip. Release the clips (x2) to remove the
            headlamp rubber grommet from the LH front fender. Install Expand All | Collapse All Secure the clips (x2) to install the headlamp rubber grommet onto the LH front
            fender. Install the frunk fender clips (x3)
            onto the LH front fender. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Replace any damaged clip. Secure the clip and the tabs (x2) to
            install the LH side repeater onto the fender. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note When the side repeater is installed
              in place, a noticeable "click" sound can be heard. Connect the LH side repeater
            connectors (x2). Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Ensure the lock on camera
              connection is secure. Position the LH front fender assembly
            onto the vehicle. Install the nuts (x2) that attach the LH lower front fender bracket to the body. 9.8 Nm (7.2 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Install the bolts (x5) that attach the LH front fender bracket to the body. 9.8 Nm (7.2 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Secure the cowl screen clip to the LH
            carrier bracket. Install the LH fascia side bracket from fender. See Bracket - Fascia Side to Fender - LH (Remove and Replace) . Install the LH headlamp. See Headlamp Assembly - LH (Remove and Replace) . Install the front fascia assembly. See Front Fascia (Remove and Replace) . Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note After installing the clips (x4) that attach the LH and RH front wheel arch liner
              to the front fascia assembly, check gap and flushness for the fender, and adjust if
              necessary. Refer to CVIS for current specification. Install the front lightbar assembly. See Lightbar - Front (Remove and Install) . Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Remove all the protective tapes. Raise the LH front window and close
            the LH front door. Remove the vehicle from the
            lift.

title: Door - Front - LH (Remove and Install)
full_text:
2025-03-12 Door - Front - LH (Remove and Install) Correction code 1010020101 FRT 0.42 NOTE: Unless
                        otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and
                        FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including
                        the linked procedures. Do
                            not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate
                            Times to learn more about FRTs and how
                        they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com . NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and
                        healthy working practices. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications : Door - Front - LH (Remove and Install) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolt that attaches the LH front door check strap to the body 24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) Torx T40 socket Reuse Nuts (x2) that attach the LH front upper and lower door hinges to the
              door 26 Nm (19.2 lbs-ft) Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm Reuse Remove Expand All | Collapse All Open the LH front door and
                        lower the LH front window. Remove the driver footwell hush panel. See Hush Panel - Footwell - Driver (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH lower A-pillar
                        trim. See A Pillar Lower Trim - LH (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the LV battery
                        power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Disconnect the J7 front door
                        connector. Release the grommet and remove the LH front door harness from the A-pillar
                        area. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Push the harness through the bulkhead from the A-pillar area. Apply tape to the LH front fender area. Apply tape surrounding the
                        hinges to mark the installation position. Remove the bolt that
                        attaches the LH front door check strap to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket Release the nuts (x2) that attach the LH front upper and lower door hinges
                        to the door. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm With assistance, lift the LH
                        front door assembly up from the vehicle, and place it on a padded
                        surface. Install Expand All | Collapse All With assistance, position
                        the LH front door assembly to the vehicle, and hand-tighten the nuts (x2)
                        that attach the LH front lower and upper door hinges to the door. Install the bolt that attaches the LH front door check strap to the
                            body. 24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket Route the LH front door harness through the outer A-pillar and install the
                        grommet. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Verify the seal if fully seated around the black grommet prior to
                            installing. Connect the J7 front door connector. Install the LH lower A-pillar trim. See A Pillar Lower Trim - LH (Remove and Replace) . Install the driver footwell hush panel. See Hush Panel - Footwell - Driver (Remove and Replace) . Connect the LV battery
                        power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Close the LH front door. Close the LH front door to
                        check for gap/flushness. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Adjust the LH front
                            door if necessary. Refer to CVIS for current specification. Open the LH front door. Torque the nuts (x2) that attach the LH front lower and upper door hinges
                        to the door. 26 Nm (19.2 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm Remove all masking
                        tapes. Raise the LH front window
                        and close the LH front door.

title: Door - Front - LH (Remove and Replace)
full_text:
2025-03-12 Door - Front - LH (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010020102 FRT 1.05 NOTE: Unless
                        otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and
                        FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including
                        the linked procedures. Do
                            not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate
                            Times to learn more about FRTs and how
                        they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com . NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and
                        healthy working practices. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications : Door - Front - LH (Remove and Install) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolt that attaches the LH front door check strap to the body 24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) Torx T40 socket Reuse Nuts (x2) that attach the LH front upper and lower door hinges to the
              door 26 Nm (19.2 lbs-ft) Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm Reuse Remove Expand All | Collapse All Open the LH front door and lower the
            LH front window. Move the LH front seat backward. Remove the secondary seal from the LH
            front door. See Secondary Seal - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH front door moving side glass. See Glass - Door - Front - LH (Model Y Premium) (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Remove the LH exterior mirror. See Exterior Mirror - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH front pressure sensor.
            See Door Pressure Sensor (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the LH front regulator
            motor connector. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Disengage the red locking tab, and
              then press down the black tab to release the connector. Remove the LH front door speaker
            woofer. See Speaker - Front Door (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH front door closeout
            panel assembly. See Closeout Panel - Window Regulator - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace) . Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note No need to remove the window
              regulator from the door closeout panel assembly. Remove the LH front outer door handle.
            See Door Handle Outer - Passive - LH - Front (Remove and Install) . Remove the LH front door latch. See Door Latch - Front - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH front door harness. See Harness - Front LH Door - Premium - LHD (Remove and Replace) . Apply tape to LH front fender. Remove the LH front door check strap.
            See Check Strap - Front (Remove and Replace) . Apply tape surrounding the hinges to
            mark the installation position. Release the nuts (x2) that attach the
            LH front upper and lower door hinges to the door. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm With assistance, lift the LH front
            door assembly up from the vehicle, and place it on a padded surface. Install Expand All | Collapse All With assistance, position the LH front
            door assembly to the vehicle, and hand-tighten the nuts (x2) that attach the LH front
            lower and upper door hinges to the door. Install the LH front door check strap. See Check Strap - Front (Remove and Replace) . Install the LH front door harness. See Harness - Front LH Door - Premium - LHD (Remove and Replace) . Install the LH front door latch. See Door Latch - Front - LH (Remove and Replace) . Install the LH front outer door handle. See Door Handle Outer - Passive - LH - Front (Remove and Install) . Install the LH front door closeout panel assembly. See Closeout Panel - Window Regulator - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace) . Install the LH front door speaker woofer. See Speaker - Front Door (Remove and Replace) . Connect the LH front regulator motor
            connector. Install the LH front pressure sensor. See Door Pressure Sensor (Remove and Replace) . Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Install the LH exterior mirror. See Exterior Mirror - LH (Remove and Replace) . Install the LH front door moving side glass. See Glass - Door - Front - LH (Model Y Premium) (Remove and Replace) . Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Return to the current procedure after installing the LH front door outer and inner
              belt seals. Close the LH front door to check for
            gap/flushness. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Adjust the LH front door if
              necessary. Refer to CVIS for current specification. Open the LH front door. Torque the nuts (x2) that attach the
            LH front lower and upper door hinges to the door. 26 Nm (19.2 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Combination Wrench 12pt 13mm Remove all masking tapes. Continue installing the LH front door moving side glass. See Glass - Door - Front - LH (Model Y Premium) (Remove and Replace) . Install the secondary seal from the LH front door. See Secondary Seal - Front Door - LH (Remove and Replace) . Install the HEPA filter assembly. See HEPA Filter Assembly (Remove and Replace) . Move the LH front seat to original
            position. Raise the LH front window and close
            the LH front door.

Torque Specifications : Hood (Remove and Install) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Nuts (x4) that secure hood to LH and RH hood hinges 27 Nm (19.9 lbs-ft) 13 mm socket Reuse Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Remove Expand All | Collapse All Remove hood striker from

          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket Install hood baffle. Install RH and LH hood bumps
                        stop to hood. Install hood striker from hood assembly. See Hood Striker (Remove and Replace) .

title: Liftgate (Remove and Install)
full_text:
2025-05-22 Liftgate (Remove and Install) Correction code 1010020401 FRT 0.40 NOTE: Unless
                        otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and
                        FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including
                        the linked procedures. Do
                            not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate
                            Times to learn more about FRTs and how
                        they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com . NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and
                        healthy working practices. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications : Liftgate (Remove and Install) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolt that attaches the liftgate harness ground bolt to the
              liftgate 10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft) 10 mm socket Replace 1128269-00-A Bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle 24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) 13 mm socket Reuse Remove Expand All | Collapse All Open the liftgate. Use a telescoping hood prop to support the liftgate. Remove the rear headliner.
                        See Rear Headliner (Remove and Replace) . Carefully release the clip
                        and location pin that attach the RH rear edge of the headliner to the
                        vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note This is to gain access to the liftgate harness connectors. Remove and discard the bolt
                        that attaches the liftgate harness ground bolt to the liftgate. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket Disconnect the liftgate harness connectors (x3). Release the RH rear liftgate
                        grommet from the body. Apply masking tape around the liftgate and liftgate hinge to mark the
                        installation positioning. Place shop towels on the LH
                        and RH side liftgate jambs. Release the spring clips
                        (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper ball studs to the liftgate,
                        and then lay the struts down on the door jamb. Figure 1. LH shown, RH similar Remove the telescoping hood
                        prop. With assistance, remove the
                        bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle, and then place the
                        liftgate on a stand. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket Install Expand All | Collapse All With assistance, position
                        the liftgate onto the vehicle, and then hand-tighten the bolts (x4) that
                        attach the liftgate to the vehicle. Warning Icon A warning icon, calling your attention to a possibly risky situation CAUTION Make sure that the hinges do
        not come into contact with the glass to prevent damage. Install the spring clips (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper
                        ball studs to the liftgate. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Make sure that the spring clip has been reset. Figure 2. LH shown, RH similar Route the liftgate harness
                        through the access hole, and then install the grommet to the body. Connect the liftgate harness
                        connectors (x3). Install a new bolt that
                        attaches the liftgate harness ground bolt to the liftgate. 10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm socket Install the clip and location pin that attach the RH rear edge of the
                        headliner to the vehicle. Install the rear headliner. See Rear Headliner (Remove and Replace) . Close the liftgate to check
                        gap/flush. With assistance, perform adjustment as necessary to the hinge
                        bolts and trunk striker. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Refer to CVIS for
                            latest specifications. Open the liftgate. Tighten the bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket Remove the masking tapes from the vehicle. Close the liftgate.

title: Liftgate (Remove and Replace)
full_text:
2025-05-22 Liftgate (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010020402 FRT 2.40 NOTE: Unless
                        otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and
                        FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including
                        the linked procedures. Do
                            not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate
                            Times to learn more about FRTs and how
                        they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com . NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and
                        healthy working practices. 1080562-00-A - TELESCOPING HOOD PROP Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications : Liftgate (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolt that attach the RH ground harness to the liftgate
              assembly 10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Replace 1128269-00-A Nuts (x3) that attach the base spoiler to the liftgate 5 Nm (3.7 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Reuse Bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle 24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) 13 mm socket Reuse LH and RH liftgate ball stud bracket bolts (x2) 20 Nm (14.7 lbs-ft) 13 mm deep socket Reuse Remove Expand All | Collapse All Open the LH front door and
                        lower the LH front window. Open the liftgate. Remove the LH and RH
                        liftgate lower bump stops. See . Remove the LH and RH liftgate wedge dampers. See Liftgate Wedge Damper - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH and RH bumper blocks. See Bump Stop - Liftgate - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH and RH lower liftgate plugs. Figure 1. LH Shown, RH Similar Remove the liftgate harness and the harness grommet. See Assembly - Harness - Liftgate - Global (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the backlite glass heater negative connector. Remove the clip and bolt that attach the RH ground harness to the liftgate
                        assembly. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the liftgate cinch latch. See Liftgate Cinch Latch (Remove and Replace) . Remove the tuned mass damper. See Tuned Mass Damper (Remove and Replace) . Remove the nuts (x3) that attach the base spoiler to the liftgate. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the spoiler outer panel. See Spoiler Outer Panel (Remove and Replace) . Remove the tail lamp. See Tail Lamp - Liftgate (Remove and Install) . Disconnect the liftgate handle switch connector. Remove the harness liftgate
                        extend from the liftgate assembly. Remove the backlight glass.
                        See Backlite Glass (Remove and Install) . Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note No need to remove the center high mounted brake light from the
                            backlight glass. Use a telescoping hood prop
                        to support the liftgate. Place shop towels on the LH
                        and RH side liftgate jambs. Release the spring clips
                        (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper ball studs to the liftgate,
                        and then lay the struts down on the door jamb. Figure 2. LH Shown, RH Similar Remove the telescoping hood
                        prop. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Assistance is recommended after removal. With assistance, remove the
                        bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle, and then place the
                        liftgate on a stand. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket Remove the LH and RH
                        liftgate ball stud bracket bolts (x2) from the liftgate. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Figure 3. LH Shown, RH Similar Remove and discard all spacer pads. Clean all remaining glass adhesive and spacer pads adhesive from the body
                        and the glass. Install Expand All | Collapse All With assistance, place the new liftgate on the support stand. Install the LH and RH liftgate ball stud bracket bolts (x2) to the
                            liftgate. 20 Nm (14.7 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Figure 4. LH Shown, RH Similar With assistance, hand-tighten the bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to
                        the vehicle. Warning Icon A warning icon, calling your attention to a possibly risky situation CAUTION Make sure that the hinges do
        not come into contact with the glass to prevent damage. Secure the spring clips (x2) that attach the LH and RH power strut upper
                        ball studs to the liftgate. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Ensure that the spring clip has been reset. Figure 5. LH Shown, RH Similar Install the liftgate harness and the harness grommet. See Assembly - Harness - Liftgate - Global (Remove and Replace) . Install the liftgate cinch latch. See Liftgate Cinch Latch (Remove and Replace) . Install the harness liftgate extend to the liftgate assembly, and install
                        the grommet. Connect the liftgate extend
                        harness connectors (x2). Connect the liftgate handle switch connector. Install the tail lamp. See Tail Lamp - Liftgate (Remove and Install) . Install the spoiler outer panel. See Spoiler Outer Panel (Remove and Replace) . Install the nuts (x3) that attach the base spoiler to the liftgate. 5 Nm (3.7 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Install the tuned mass damper. See Tuned Mass Damper (Remove and Replace) . Install the LH and RH liftgate wedge dampers. See Liftgate Wedge Damper - LH (Remove and Replace) . Install the LH and RH bumper blocks. See Bump Stop - Liftgate - LH (Remove and Replace) . Install the LH and RH liftgate lower bump stops. See . Install the LH and RH lower liftgate plugs. Figure 6. LH Shown, RH Similar Close the liftgate to check gap/flush, and perform adjustments as
                        necessary. Open the liftgate. Install the bolts (x4) that attach the liftgate to the vehicle, and then
                        place the liftgate on a stand. 24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm socket Apply touch up pain to the head of the LH and RH liftgate hinge bolts as
                        necessary. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Make sure to shake the touch up paint before applying. If a 2nd coat
                            is necessary, allow the 1st coat to dry for 20 minutes before applying a
                            2nd one. Install the backlight glass. See Backlite Glass (Remove and Install) . If quipped, install the Chinese Tesla badge. See Badge - Tesla Chinese (Remove and Replace) . Install the Model Y/Model Y+ badge. See Badge - Model Y (Remove and Replace) or Badge - Model Y+ (Remove and Replace) . If quipped, install the Dual Motor badge. See Badge - Dual Motor (Remove and Replace) . Connect the electrical
                        connector, and then install the clip that attaches the center high mounted
                        brake light connector to the body. Install the clip and bolt that attach the RH ground harness to the liftgate
                            assembly. 10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Connect the backlite glass heater negative connector. Connect the backlight glass
                        heater positive connector. Install the lower liftgate
                        trim. See Liftgate Lower Trim (Remove and Replace) . Place the vehicle in
                        Service Mode by using the touchscreen. See Service Mode . Unlock the vehicle gateway. See Gateway (Unlock) . On the touchscreen, tap the
                        Service Mode "wrench" (at the bottom of the touchscreen UI), and then tap Driver
                                Assist > Cameras > Clear Camera
                                Calibration , select RearView in the Camera Selection drop
                        list, click Run , and allow the routine to complete. Exit Service Mode. See Service Mode . Raise the LH front window
                        and close the LH front door. Remove the masking tapes
                        after the urethane has cured. Warning Icon A warning icon, calling your attention to a possibly risky situation CAUTION Do not drive the vehicle until the adhesive manufacturers recommended
        minimum drive-away time has passed. Dow Betaseal Express has a drive-away time of 1 hour
        minimum in temperatures of 0F (-18C) or warmer. If necessary, leave the tape applying
        pressure to the glass on the vehicle and advise the customer that they can remove it after
        24 hours. Additionally, advise the customer that they should avoid high driving speeds and
        speed bumps for the next 24 hours.

title: Pencil Brace - Wiper Bracket - RH (Remove and Replace)
full_text:
2025-11-06 Pencil Brace - Wiper Bracket - RH (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010055302 FRT 0.30 NOTE: Unless
                        otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and
                        FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including
                        the linked procedures. Do
                            not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate
                            Times to learn more about FRTs and how
                        they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com . NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and
                        healthy working practices. 2025-11-04: Updated the
            torque of the NVH brace bolts (x2) from 18.8 Nm to 27 Nm. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications : Pencil Brace - Wiper Bracket - LH (Remove and Replace) / Pencil Brace - Wiper Bracket - RH (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolts (x2) that attaches the LH/RH wiper bracket pencil brace to the
              body 27 Nm (19.9 lbs-ft) 13 mm deep socket Reuse Remove Expand All | Collapse All Remove the cowl screen. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace) . Remove the bolts (x2) that attaches
            the RH wiper bracket pencil brace to the body, and then remove the brace from the
            vehicle. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Install Expand All | Collapse All Hand-tighten the bolts (x2) that
            attaches the RH wiper bracket pencil brace to the body, and then torque them. 27 Nm (19.9 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Be careful not to damage the windshield. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Install the cowl screen. See Cowl Screen (Remove and Replace) .

title: Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Install)
full_text:
2025-03-12 Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Install) Correction code 1010020501 FRT 0.48 NOTE: Unless
                        otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and
                        FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including
                        the linked procedures. Do
                            not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate
                            Times to learn more about FRTs and how
                        they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com . NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and
                        healthy working practices. Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications : Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Install) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Bolt that attaches the LH rear door check strap to the body 24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) Torx T40 socket 4 in extension Reuse Bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges 49 Nm (36.1 lbs-ft) 13 mm deep socket Reuse Remove Expand All | Collapse All Open the LH doors and lower the LH windows. Place the vehicle in
                        Service Mode by using the touchscreen. See Service Mode . Disconnect the LV battery
                        power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Release the grommet between the 2 hinges, and then release the clips (x2)
                        that attach the electrical harness connector to the door to disconnect the
                        harness from the B-pillar area. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Release the top clip at first, and then while pressing the top one,
                            release the bottom clip. Use tape to mark the position of the LH rear door hinges and the LH rear
                        door check strap. Figure 1. Check Strap Area as Example Remove the bolt that
                        attaches the LH rear door check strap to the body. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Unbolting the door
                            check allows the door to swing freely beyond opening limits. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket 4 in extension With assistance, loosen the
                        bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges, and then
                        fully remove the bottom bolt, then fully remove the top bolt. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket With assistance, remove the LH rear door assembly from the vehicle, and
                        place it on a padded surface. Install Expand All | Collapse All With assistance, position the LH rear door assembly to the vehicle. With assistance, hand-tighten the bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door
                        assembly to the hinges. Install the bolt that attaches the LH rear door check strap to the
                            body. 24 Nm (17.7 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: Torx T40 socket 4 in extension Verify the seal is fully seated around the white clips. Secure the clips (x2) that attach the electrical harness connector to the
                        door until there is an audible click, and then seat the grommet into
                        position. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Gently pull the harness to ensure the connector is fully
                            secure. Connect the LV battery power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Close the LH rear door to check for gap/flushness. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Adjust the LH rear door if necessary. Refer to CVIS for current
                            specification. Open the LH rear door. With assistance, torque the bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door
                        assembly to the hinges. 49 Nm (36.1 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Remove all masking tapes. Raise the LH rear window and lower the LH rear door. Unlock the vehicle gateway. See Gateway (Unlock) . On the touchscreen, tap the Service Mode "wrench" (at the bottom of the
                        touchscreen UI), and then tap Closures > Windows > Rear Left Calibrate , click Run , and allow the routine to
                        complete. Exit Service Mode. See Service Mode . Raise the LH front window
                        and close the LH front door.

title: Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace)
full_text:
2025-07-01 Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) Correction code 1010020502 FRT 1.20 NOTE: Unless
                        otherwise explicitly stated in the procedure, the above correction code and
                        FRT reflect all of the work required to perform this procedure, including
                        the linked procedures. Do
                            not stack correction codes unless explicitly told to do so. NOTE: See Flat Rate
                            Times to learn more about FRTs and how
                        they are created. To provide feedback on FRT values, email ServiceManualFeedback@tesla.com . NOTE: See Personal Protection to make sure wearing proper PPE when performing the below procedure. NOTE: See Ergonomic Precautions for safe and
                        healthy working practices. 2025-07-01: Added part numbers for rear door secondary seal. Window Switch Tool - 1454796-00-B BODY GAP & FLUSH GAUGE, MODEL Y - 1588903-00-A SECONDARY SEAL, REAR DOOR, LH, MY - 1500060-00-B or SECONDARY SEAL, REAR DOOR, RH, MY - 1500061-00-B Parent topic: 1010 - Body Panels Torque Specifications Table 1. Torque Specifications : Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) Description Torque Value Recommended Tools Reuse/Replace Notes Screws (x2) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the
              LH rear door 10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Reuse Bolts (x11) that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear
              door 4.5 Nm (3.3 lbs-ft) 8 mm socket Reuse Bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges 49 Nm (36.1 lbs-ft) 13 mm deep socket Reuse Bolts (x2) that attach the window glass to the regulator guide blocks 12 Nm (8.8 lbs-ft) 10 mm deep socket Reuse Remove Expand All | Collapse All Place the vehicle in
                        Service Mode by using the touchscreen. See Service Mode . Remove the HEPA filter
                        assembly. See HEPA Filter Assembly (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH rear door outer belt. See Outer Belt - Rear Door - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH rear door trim panel. See Door Trim - Rear - LH (Remove and Install) . Remove the LH rear door window glass. See Glass - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) . Disconnect the LV battery
                        power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Disconnect the electrical
                        harness from the LH rear window motor. Disconnect the electrical
                        harness from the LH rear door pressure sensor. Release the clip that
                        attaches the manual latch release cable to the LH rear window closeout
                        assembly. Release the clips (x3) that
                        attach the LH rear door harness to the LH rear window closeout
                        assembly. Remove the plugs (x2) that
                        cover the LH rear window closeout assembly rail fasteners. Remove the screws (x2) that
                        attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Remove the bolts (x11) that
                        attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door, and then
                        gently lift the closeout assembly upwards to release the datums and angle
                        the bottom of the assembly from the door. Warning Icon A warning icon, calling your attention to a possibly risky situation CAUTION Never
                            loosen or remove the nuts (x4) that attach the regulator arms to the
                            assembly closeout panel. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 8 mm socket Disconnect the LH rear outer door handle connector. Disconnect the LH rear door
                        electrical harness from the LH rear door latch connector. Release the harness clips (x7) from the LH rear door. Release the grommet between
                        the 2 hinges, and then release the clips (x2) that attach the electrical
                        harness connector to the door to disconnect the harness from the B-pillar
                        area. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Release the top clip at
                            first, and then while pressing the top one, release the bottom
                            clip. Remove the rubber grommet from the LH rear door assembly. Remove the clip bases (x10) from the LH rear door. Remove the LH rear door latch. See Door Latch - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH rear outer door handle. See Handle - Exterior Release - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) . Remove the LH rear door check strap. See Check Strap - Rear (Remove and Replace) . With assistance, loosen the
                        bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges, and then
                        fully remove the bottom bolt, then fully remove the top bolt. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket With assistance, remove the
                        LH rear door assembly from the vehicle, and place it on a padded
                        surface. Install Expand All | Collapse All With assistance, position
                        the LH rear door assembly to the vehicle. With assistance,
                        hand-tighten the bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the
                        hinges. Install the LH rear door check strap. See Check Strap - Rear (Remove and Replace) . Install the LH rear outer door handle. See Handle - Exterior Release - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) . Install the LH rear door latch. See Door Latch - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) . Install the clip bases (x10) to the LH rear door. Install the rubber grommet to the LH rear door assembly. Verify the seal is fully
                        seated around the white clips. Secure the clips (x2) that
                        attach the electrical harness connector to the door until there is an
                        audible click, and then seat the grommet into position. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Gently pull the harness
                            to ensure the connector is fully secure. Install the harness clips (x7) to the LH rear door. Connect the LH rear door electrical harness to the LH rear door latch
                        connector. Connect the LH rear outer door handle connector. Install the LH rear window
                        closeout assembly up and into the LH rear door, and then install the datums
                        that attach the closeout assembly to the LH rear door. Install the screws (x11)
                        that attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door. 4.5 Nm (3.3 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 8 mm socket Install the screws (x2) that
                        attach the LH rear window closeout assembly to the LH rear door. 10 Nm (7.4 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Install the plugs (x2) that
                        cover the LH rear window closeout assembly rail fasteners. Fasten the clips (x3) that
                        attach the LH rear door harness to the LH rear window closeout
                        assembly. Connect the electrical
                        harness to the LH rear door pressure sensor. Connect the electrical
                        harness to the LH rear window closeout assembly. Install the clip that
                        attaches the manual latch release cable to the LH rear window closeout
                        assembly. Connect the LV battery
                        power. See LV Power (Disconnect and Connect) (Modify) . Close the LH rear door to
                        check for gap/flushness. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Adjust the LH rear door
                            if necessary. Refer to CVIS for current specification. Open the LH rear door. With assistance, torque the
                        bolts (x2) that attach the LH rear door assembly to the hinges. 49 Nm (36.1 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 13 mm deep socket Install the LH rear door outer belt. See Outer Belt - Rear Door - LH (Remove and Replace) . Install the LH rear door window glass. See Glass - Door - Rear - LH (Remove and Replace) . Use IPA wipes to clean the area where the secondary seal will be
                        installed. Peel back the adhesive backing of the secondary seal and position the seal
                        onto the rear section of the LH rear door. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Ensure the drain holes of the seal are at the bottom of the door.
                            Ensure both edges are under the cut-outs for the inner belt seal and
                            glass run seal. Ensure the open edge of the seal is facing the inside of
                            the door. Firmly press the seal into place while removing the film from the
                        double-sided tape. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Ensure the seal is even all the way around the edge of the door. Align
                            the seal with the positioning tape when pasting. Install the LH rear door
                        inner belt seal. See Inner Belt Seal - Rear Door - LH (Remove and Replace) . Release the LH rear door latch. Raise the LH rear window and
                        close the LH rear door. Check the LH rear window for gap/flushness. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Adjust the LH rear window with assistance if necessary. The gap should
                            be 8.0 1.75 mm and the flushness should be 0.0 2.0 mm. Open the LH rear door. Close the LH rear door latch to allow the window height adjustment. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Do not close the door with the window fully raised, as the upper
                            bright trim will be damaged. Adjust the glass for access to the regulator guide blocks. Loosen the bolts (x2) that attach the window glass to the regulator guide
                        blocks about half a turn to maintain the position but still allow
                        adjustment. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Adjust the front of the moving glass to achieve the flush target to the
                        B-Pillar applique. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use a 5mm hex socket to adjust the friction pad to tilt the glass
                            inboard or outboard. Turn clockwise to achieve outboard adjustments and
                            turn counter-clockwise to achieve inboard adjustments. Adjust the rear of the moving glass to achieve the flush target to the
                        quarter glass assembly. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Use a 5mm hex socket to adjust the friction pad to tilt the glass
                            inboard or outboard. Turn clockwise to achieve outboard adjustments and
                            turn counter-clockwise to achieve inboard adjustments. Hand-tighten the bolts (x2) that attach the window glass to the regulator
                        guide blocks. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Release the LH rear door latch. Close the LH rear door. Check the LH rear window for gap/flushness. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Adjust the LH rear window with assistance if necessary. The gap should
                            be 8.0 1.75 mm and the flushness should be 0.0 2.0 mm. Open the LH rear door. Close the LH rear door latch to allow the window height adjustment. Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention Note Do not close the door with the window fully raised, as the upper
                            bright trim will be damaged. Adjust the glass for access to the regulator guide blocks. Torque the bolts (x2) that attach the window glass to the regulator guide
                            blocks. 12 Nm (8.8 lbs-ft) Informational Purposes An informational icon, calling your attention TIp Use of the following
          tool(s) is recommended: 10 mm deep socket Install the plugs that cover
                        the openings into the door. Release the LH rear door latch. Fully lower the window, and disconnect the window switch special tool from
                        the LH rear door harness. Install the LH rear door trim panel. See Door Trim - Rear - LH (Remove and Install) . Unlock the vehicle gateway. See Gateway (Unlock) . On the touchscreen, tap the
                        Service Mode "wrench" (at the bottom of the touchscreen UI), and then tap Closures > Windows > Rear Left
                                Calibrate , click Run , and
                        allow the routine to complete. Exit Service Mode. See Service Mode . Raise the LH front window and close the LH front door.
